communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request copies of any administrative memoranda, guidance documents, training materials, manuals, policy statements, or internal communications issued by or maintained by the Office of the Director of State Courts that address:

• fee-waiver determinations,
• indigency screening,
• conditional fee-waiver orders, or
• clerk communications to litigants regarding filing-fee obligations.

This request is limited to administrative and operational records and does not seek records reflecting judicial deliberations, judicial decision-making, or communications regarding the merits of any case.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide the non-exempt portions and identify the specific statutory basis for any redaction or withholding.

This request is made for public-interest and policy-review purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexander Lennon

To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Wisconsin Open Records Law, Wis. Stat. §§ 19.31–19.39.

I request any administrative guidance, memoranda, clerk manuals, internal instructions, or training materials addressing:

• sua sponte conversion of appeals to supervisory writ proceedings, and
• treatment of filing-fee obligations or fee-waiver status following such conversion.

This request is limited to administrative and procedural records and does not seek judicial deliberations or records related to the merits of any case.

If no such guidance exists, please confirm that in writing.

This request is made for public-interest and policy-review purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexander Lennon

To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Wisconsin Open Records Law, Wis. Stat. §§ 19.31–19.39.

I request copies of any training materials, presentations, manuals, or instructional documents used to train clerks or clerk staff regarding:

• interactions with self-represented litigants,
• fee-waiver screening communications, or
• responding to litigant inquiries concerning filing-fee obligations.

This request seeks administrative training materials only and does not request records related to judicial decision-making.

This request is made for public-interest and policy-review purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexander Lennon

To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Wisconsin Open Records Law, Wis. Stat. §§ 19.31–19.39.

I request any aggregate or statistical data maintained by the Wisconsin Court System reflecting:

• the number of fee-waiver requests filed annually,
• the number granted and denied, and
• any breakdown by court level (circuit court vs. appellate court),

for the most recent five calendar years for which such data is available.

This request seeks non-identifying, aggregate data only and does not request information identifying individual judges, litigants, or cases.

If such data is not maintained in compiled form, please identify any existing reports or summaries that partially respond to this request.

This request is made for public-interest and policy-review purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexander Lennon

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This is a request under the Wisconsin Open Records Law, Wis. Stat. §§ 19.31–19.39.

I request copies of any form letters, templates, standardized correspondence, or model language used or recommended for clerk communications regarding:

• “pay the filing fee or show good cause” notices,
• conditional fee-waiver communications, or
• correspondence addressing filing-fee obligations following appellate procedural changes (including appeal-to-writ conversion).

This request seeks administrative records only and does not request records concerning judicial reasoning or case-specific adjudication.

If responsive records exist in multiple versions or revisions, please provide the most current version and any prior versions still in use during the past five years.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexander Lennon
